This program will not even open small files.

Review on Review: "Couldn't open existing GIF" is a review that I've been reporting as irrelevant and pointless. It stands in the HEADLINE "VIDEO TO GIF" - what is so hard to understand here? OF COURSE it won't open a GIF, conehead??

description: Installs and launches on Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS.
Tried to open multiple different mp4s under 10-20mb and the app just says "can't open this file"
summary: can't open anything, won't tell you why

description:
I managed to get acceptable GIFs with this tool after trying unsuccessfully to play with ffmpeg options for quite some time, so thank you very much to the authors!
That said, this app really need improvements: though I like the funky color, would be nice to respect the OS's style by default... even the file-opener is purple!? The UX is pretty bad: difficult to understand how to change things, the buttons don't really work sometimes, you can't drag the sliders with the mouse... but the worst is how heavy this app is: on idle, it managed to bring my laptop to a crawl (taking like 30% of all my CPU cores - hope it's not mining bitcoins). This is certainly not a great demo for Haskell. Just open it, generate the gif, and immediately close it if you don't want your CPU burning hot.
summary: Funky and heavy but does the job

description: worst wrewrewrwr
Couldn't even get it to open an mp4 file
summary: Couldn't even get it to open an mp4 file

description: says ffmpeg misses filters, cannot open any videos
Had to uninstall this snap and download the AppImage release from the Gifcurry github, which worked great. -1 star for that. It's a good ware though
Converts videos to gif. I use it all the time.

while this may be good to MAKE an animated gif, it's no good at editing an existing animated gif. It wouldn't drill into the secondary drives on the system, nor could I find the way to check or set preferences etc.
Fourth time I have installed, not working on my up to date ubuntu 20.10. Cant open mp4, wmv, opened mkv, but no preview. This must be taken off the store.
Mfgg files missing and no setting, etc.

Gifcurry, the program, seems to do its job.
It will convert video files to gifs.
It has bugs, crashes frequently, and maps a 1026.4 GB of memory, but it does work.

You need to get the AppImage from the website, though. This snap image doesn't work properly, and the nature of snap itself means this is pretty much useless (it can't read from additiobal partitions, where most of store our media.)
While it says, it doesn't work for some formats, it didn't even work for MP4
Not working and no giving error message
summary: Not working and no giving error message

description: the warning says that ffmpeg is missing files even though i literally just updated it. it won't open any video file in any format. useless.

description: can install and launch, but it fails to open any video file regardless of location, size or format.
says missing ffmpeg decoders
Wirkt unaufgeräumt und war mir nicht hilfreich dabei ein GIF zu erstellen.

Gemischte Gefühle. Das Tool hat großes Potential und lässt die Nutzer*innen GIFs so einfach wie Video-Edits schneiden. Leider hat das Snap noch viele Fehler. Das GUI ist schlecht in Gnome integriert und den Snap fehlt offenbar Zugriff auf wichtige ffmpeg Codecs
summary: Großes Potential, aber noch viele Fehler

description: por la interfaz llamativa
es muy buena , crea muchas gifs

Il faut juste lui laisser le temps pour charger les gifs au démarrage. A force d'utilisation on se familiarise avec l'interface mais tout fonctionne bien au final. C'est très bien pour un logiciel gratuit! Merci au développeur!
